ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Live virtual lecture, but lectures were recorded if students needed to view it later.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned important modern synthetic strategies, especially the use of catalysts and chiral auxiliaries. Unlike general organic chemistry, these reactions are those that would actually be used in a lab, and much of the psets/exams is deciding which strategy works best.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: An amazing course!! Definitely the best chem course I've taken  weaknesses obviously include the virtual nature of the lecture, but Jon did a great job lecturing regardless. I really appreciated having the lectures recorded, as I could go back and watch them later if I missed anything. Again, because lecture was virtual, we couldn't view multiple chalkboards at once  this sometimes detracted from direct comparisons Jon was trying to make, or sometimes I didn't catch everything that was written (but being able to view the recorded lecture/having pdfs of the lecture was really helpful). Strengths: everything but the virtual nature, Jon, the clear and organized lecture style and direction of the course. Psets and exams are also returned super quickly, with clear feedback (and there are answer keys).

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: See answers above. Having lectures recorded/having pdfs of lecture available was super helpful when I didn't catch something. Not being able to view multiple chalkboards/screens is just a part of the virtual nature of this class.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes! If you are at all interested in chemical biology or organic chemistry, or just want to experience a science lecture/class that is taught WELL, take this course. Jon is an incredible professor, and I learned so much. There are weekly psets, but they're accessible/clear and Jon holds office hours to help you. This course is really well facilitated for student learning :)
